website_summaries.verdict: Merrell Agility Peak Flex, known for its agility and support on a variety of terrains, is an ideal shoe for trail running and hiking. It also satisfies the fashion sense of conscious customers through its nice aesthetic look and may be used daily as casual footwear. Overall, the shoe is an excellent package of comfort and flexibility and provides a perfect fit for the runner's foot.
pros: The customers felt extremely comfortable with the soft cushioning of the Merrell Agility Peak Flex
A majority of the runners preferred this shoe for trail running and trail walking, owing to its flexible build that’s suited for rough terrains
Many of its wearers were happy with the supportive mid-sole because they felt less pressure under their feet
Customers were also happy with the snug fit and adjustable nature of the shoe
it remained true to their size on almost every ground level
A few buyers were attracted by the colors available for this shoe
A runner felt an increase in his mobility in these shoes during his run
the shoes adjusted to the feet’s movements better than any shoes he had tried in the past
cons: A customer felt some reduction in his grip on the ground during his uphill runs
Another user was dissatisfied with the construction of the upper’s heel area because it didn't provide enough support as other running shoes he had used before

customer_reviews.title: Weird arch
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Merrell since 1996. They always fit me perfectly. These ones did not. The arch was in the wrong spot. I don't know if it is a flaw or on purpose. But I bought a different model and they were again perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Another great shoe from Merrell
customer_reviews.text: toe box is a little different shape than others styles I've had in the past, but it's not bad. took me a few days for the outside of my foot to get used to it. but a lot more arch support than other merrells, too (not that those weren't fine, but this is pronounced). Very comfortable shoe. Great traction. Again, the comfort is amazing. My biggest complaint, and this is a knit pick, is that the shoelaces are 'stretchy' and can be difficult to get the undone without taking your shoes off like an 8 year old. ;) I'll manage.
customer_reviews.author: Chris in ATX

customer_reviews.title: Love Merrells, but this one didn't work out.  A dud?
customer_reviews.text: I love Merrell shoes. These were my first athletic-styled shoes from Merrell. Got the usual comfort I expect from them except for one thing: my left foot doesn't seem to fit squarely in the shoe. There's a tendon or nerve that constantly rolls off the side of the insert and it is pretty aggravating. I'm not sure if the insert is too small or what. I've never had this issue before with any shoe ever. Maybe I got a dud of a left shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: The length of the shoe is great, but the lacing system makes for a tight ...
customer_reviews.text: The length of the shoe is great, but the lacing system makes for a tight fit around the foot. After breaking them in, they feel fine, but I've got to be careful not to tighten them too tight. I don't know if it's the laces or the lace system, but when tied tight, it really squeezes my foot. But I did just run a 16 mile race in them, and other than stopping to tighten them once, they preformed great!
customer_reviews.author: Jason P Dupree

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe; a bit narrow.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. I wear it walking on asphalt to provide more support. Doesn't last wuite as long as running shoes, but treats my feet with more respect. A bit narrow; only available in one width.
customer_reviews.author: Jim H.

customer_reviews.title: Weird shoe laces
customer_reviews.text: As always with Merrell, these running shoes are amazing!!! Fits perfectly. Only issues I have is with the shoes laces. They are thing and feel as though they could break at anytime. Switched them out for piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: jasmin vorhes

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable trail running shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit like a glove! I have narrow ankles and heels and Merrell shoes usually offer a better fit than other brands, these shoes were no exception. Only had them out for several runs, a total of about 12 miles, but they are comfortable and grip the trail great.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard Zavaski

customer_reviews.title: Equally great arch support & traction
customer_reviews.text: A solidly constructed trail shoe. My favorite feature is the higher than normal arch support. Secondly, I really like the traction in that it’s difinitive when the surface you’re trekking on isn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with the design
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these shoes, but somehow, Merrell managed to place the arch too far forward. They feel awkward. I’ve run in Merrell All Out Peaks for a few years, and thought these were going to replace them, but they just feel wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Rob A.

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best running shoes for trail or everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: sleek, light weight and an aggressive tread for off pavment use. Hands down the best money you can spend for your feet and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable shoe that can be worn almost anywhere. I've even gotten a compliment or two on how they look.
customer_reviews.author: Dave M 44

customer_reviews.title: ... these shoes for treadmill running but they are extremely comfortable, much more comfortable than the Merrell Light Trail ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I've only used these shoes for treadmill running but they are extremely comfortable, much more comfortable than the Merrell Light Trail Running shoes they replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P Carr

customer_reviews.title: Not so Good
customer_reviews.text: Soles seem a little unstable, not impressed with manufacture. Heel of right shoe is unven, can feel a wrinkle but can't see it.
customer_reviews.author: Lutheran

customer_reviews.title: ... through trails in NC and I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.text: I've had them for about a week now and put about 18 miles on them running through trails in NC and I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable casual shoes. I need more support than typical tennis shoes and these are really good.
customer_reviews.author: Rick O

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoe that I wear around town and to the gym.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great fit well made comfortable out of the box Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Chip S

customer_reviews.title: Bright but I like bright. they do flex as needed
customer_reviews.text: So far i Luv them. Bright but I like bright. they do flex as needed. taller than a running shoe. the mesh on top is very breathable. So far I wear them for my daily work shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Bill M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes. They fit perfectly and I enjoy wearing them. Comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are the nicest shoes I have ever owned. ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the nicest shoes I have ever owned. No sign of planter faciatis when wearing these. Use them for walking, hiking, teaching, coaching, and playing volleyball
customer_reviews.author: Slater Michael Bird

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is nice, fits well, poorly construct/fit insole. The insole slips, recommend purchasing an alternate insole.
customer_reviews.author: Finn

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: There's a little more heel height than I typically like.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes provide great support and comfort for my time on the trail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another good Merrell product
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Seems well made, like all the Merrell shoes I have worn.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: This is why I don't like buying online the shoes doesn't fit properly
customer_reviews.text: The size is too small what other shoes brands are. This is why I don't like buying online the shoes doesn't fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: Destaw B Addis

customer_reviews.title: My husband has bad foot pain from being on his feet all day ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband has bad foot pain from being on his feet all day and we ordered these shoes and he says he can tell a huge difference and these are the best!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good for marathon training
customer_reviews.text: Too soft to the point they wear towards one direction. No go for me.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Best work shoes ever
customer_reviews.text: At first I wasn't sure about this as work shoes. But I said the hell with it. I average about 3 miles of walking everyday and with that being said the shoe holds up to the beating. The shoe is extremely comfortable, and the tread on the shoe is awesome as well
customer_reviews.author: Johnson101

product_meta.title: Merrell Agility Peak Flex Trail Running Shoes - AW17
product_meta.description: Merrell Agility Peak Flex Trail Running Shoes Get ready to tear up the trails in the Merrell Agility Peak Flex Trail Running Shoes. Featuring a hefty grip, Hyperlock Technology and reflective details, these shoes provide everything you need and more to excel on long runs and rugged terrain. Mesh and TPU Upper A combination of fabric, mesh and TPU make up the materials for the upper, making it durable and breathable even in warm weather. The mesh allows air to circulate through the shoe to the foot, creating excellent ventilation in the process. Meanwhile, the TPU detailing protects the shoes from any wear and tear you'll undoubtedly encounter out on the trails, such as sharp rocks or branches. The lace-up front complete with Merrell Omni-fit Lacing System allows a snug, glove like fit to minimise your foot moving within the shoe during long runs. M-select Fresh antimicrobial agents also feature throughout the shoe to minimise odour and prevents moisture or sweat affecting the freshness of your shoes. EVA Midsole The midsole, consisting of a comfortable EVA cushioning offers extra protection against uneven ground and minimises your discomfort at all times. FLEXconnect EVA dual-directional flex-groove Technology increases your stability, letting you remain agile even on rough, rocky and uneven ground. A Hyperlock moulded TPU heel counter features provides extra security during quick decents and sharp turns, making these shoes perfect for mountain-side or hilly trails. For extra comfort a EVA foot bed is located in the shoe, which can be removed or changed according to your preference. Grip+ Outsole Featuring an M-select Grip+ Outsole, these shoes offer incredible grip and unbelievable traction. Skeleton-style lugs allows the outsole to stick to any ground, either wet or dry, making these shoes ideal for any kind of weather. The outsole is also highly durable, and releases dirt and debris as you run with its specialised lugs.
